  <summary>Better initial load experience</summary>
  <description>Currently there&#39;s a flash of the fallback styles before a theme class loads. It&#39;d be good to figure out a way to not have the transitions apply on first load for a more snappy-feeling first impression</description>

  <author>
    <name>Rik Williams</name>
    <email/>
  </author>
  <summary>Empathy Balloons</summary>
  <description># Empathy balloons
Impaired attention and/or motor control
![empathy-balloons-inclusive-design-game-solo (1)](/uploads/2f21c9b357b42751d8cb814c6d06824b/59917057-c2cf4400-9418-11e9-89e4-062bef737689.gif)

## Prompt directions

Compl...</description>
  <content># Empathy balloons
Impaired attention and/or motor control
![empathy-balloons-inclusive-design-game-solo (1)](/uploads/2f21c9b357b42751d8cb814c6d06824b/59917057-c2cf4400-9418-11e9-89e4-062bef737689.gif)

## Prompt directions

Complete a 'complex' task one-handed whilst bouncing a balloon with the other hand (and/or whilst holding a conversation). 


## Prompt description

This prompt helps you understand what it's like to have attention deficit, limited cognition and/or a motor condition. Actual, or contextual to lifestyle. 


Source: https://rikwilliams.net/ux/accessibility/empathy-balloons-game-inclusive-design/</content>

  <title>Tm Theme Editor</title>
  <updated>2023-03-27T23:15:19Z</updated>
  <media:thumbnail width="40" height="40" url="https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/0427d82f506848ec93e7be6b7da98751?s=80&d=identicon"/>
  <author>
    <name>earle</name>
    <email/>
  </author>
  <summary>Tm Theme Editor</summary>
  <description>Hi!

Good day to you! I greatly appreciate the efforts and work going into the a11y-syntax-highlighting project. I have seen much positive feedback on A11y Dark theme on Carbon and I share that sentiment. A11y Dark is one of the best the...</description>
  <content>Hi!

Good day to you! I greatly appreciate the efforts and work going into the a11y-syntax-highlighting project. I have seen much positive feedback on A11y Dark theme on Carbon and I share that sentiment. A11y Dark is one of the best themes I have seen in a while. Are you aware of any efforts to add A11y Dark theme to the Tm Theme Editor Website? 

https://tmtheme-editor.herokuapp.com/#!/editor/theme/Monokai

I would be happy to assist to build one but would need to know all of the possible scope names and associated foreground/background hex values. I would not want to make any assumptions and diverge from the appropriate color theme.

Thanks so much!</content>

  </assignee>
</entry>
<entry>
  <id>http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/issues/1208</id>
  <link href="http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/issues/1208"/>
  <title>Inaccessibility: Low contrast .c-card__additional in Featured Resource Card</title>
  <updated>2023-03-23T08:41:26Z</updated>
  <media:thumbnail width="40" height="40" url="https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/e64c7d89f26bd1972efa854d13d7dd61?s=80&d=identicon"/>
  <author>
    <name>Administrator</name>
    <email/>
  </author>
  <summary>Inaccessibility: Low contrast .c-card__additional in Featured Resource Card</summary>
  <description>*Created by: kelsS*

Please review our Contributing guidelines:
https://a11yproject.com/contributing-guidelines/

## Summary
When you right-click on the featured resource card link the text for the `.c-card__additional` paragraph cha...</description>
  <content>*Created by: kelsS*

Please review our Contributing guidelines:
https://a11yproject.com/contributing-guidelines/

## Summary
When you right-click on the featured resource card link the text for the `.c-card__additional` paragraph changes to white over the green background of the card and has very low contrast.

> Brief description of the issue. Please identify specific steps.

> 1. Navigate to https://www.a11yproject.com/resources/ 
> 2. Hover over the main link in the featured resource card
> 3. Right-click on the main link in the featured resource card

### Expected result
Expect that the text color for `.c-card__additional` does not change to white.

### Actual result
The text turns to white and is then not readable.

![color-contrast-issue-a11yproject](/uploads/f701698a60516006fa41061a8e69782e/110964325-12f2e600-8321-11eb-8a65-c3900d5b4206.gif)

### Additional Information

> To help us try and reproduce the issue, please provide the following information:
> 1. What device were you using? (laptop, phone, tablet, etc.)
    Macbook Pro 16 inch

> 2. Operating System version.
   macOS Big Sur 11.2.3

> 3. Browser(s) and version(s).
   Firefox Developer Edition, latest version.

> 4. Assistive technology used (if applicable)

### Additional Information

Note anything else you think would be important to know that didn't fall into an above category.
</content>

    <label>accessibility</label>
    <label>resource</label>
    <label>styling</label>
  </labels>

<entry>
  <id>http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/issues/1294</id>
  <link href="http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/issues/1294"/>
  <title>Non-Github contribution guidelines need clarification</title>
  <updated>2023-03-23T08:41:38Z</updated>
  <media:thumbnail width="40" height="40" url="https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/99a4297c867eada2606b9b6973f081f9?s=80&d=identicon"/>
  <author>
    <name>Byte Blaze</name>
    <email></email>
  </author>
  <summary>Non-Github contribution guidelines need clarification</summary>
  <description>Originating from a conversation with @mxmason.

Currently, our only language around how people who don&#39;t use Github can contribute is listed on our [Write for us](https://www.a11yproject.com/write-for-us/#if-you-do-not-have-a-github-ac...</description>
  <content>Originating from a conversation with @mxmason.

Currently, our only language around how people who don't use Github can contribute is listed on our [Write for us](https://www.a11yproject.com/write-for-us/#if-you-do-not-have-a-github-account) page. There are two issues with this from my perspective:

1. The content is not on our [Contributing Guidelines](https://www.a11yproject.com/contributing-guidelines/), or cross-linked there.
1. The process is still too opaque to give a potential contributor an idea of what a non-Github content contribution process looks like.

We need to expand on this so it is more transparent and approachable. While we utilize Github as a method to run the site, it should not be a barrier for participation.

Ideally, part of this involves people who have contributed without using Github who would be willing to identify areas of confusion or friction.</content>
  <labels>
    <label>claimed</label>
    <label>content</label>
  </labels>
  <assignees>
    <assignee>
      <name>Byte Blaze</name>
      <email></email>
    </assignee>
  </assignees>
  <assignee>
    <name>Byte Blaze</name>
    <email></email>
  </assignee>
</entry>
<entry>
  <id>http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/issues/1360</id>
  <link href="http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/issues/1360"/>
  <title>The process for writing for us is both scattered and buried</title>
  <updated>2023-03-23T08:41:46Z</updated>
  <media:thumbnail width="40" height="40" url="https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/99a4297c867eada2606b9b6973f081f9?s=80&d=identicon"/>
  <author>
    <name>Byte Blaze</name>
    <email></email>
  </author>
  <summary>The process for writing for us is both scattered and buried</summary>
  <description>Compensation information is only listed on [our Contribute page](https://www.a11yproject.com/contribute/#posts). Post requirements are hidden away deep in [our Contributing Guidelines](https://www.a11yproject.com/contributing-guidelines/...</description>
  <content>Compensation information is only listed on [our Contribute page](https://www.a11yproject.com/contribute/#posts). Post requirements are hidden away deep in [our Contributing Guidelines](https://www.a11yproject.com/contributing-guidelines/#posts).

We should consolidate this information to its own page, potentially referencing an approach similar to [Smashing Magazine](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/write-for-us/) and other similar publications.</content>
  <labels>
    <label>content</label>
    <label>design</label>
  </labels>

  </assignee>
</entry>
<entry>
  <id>http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/issues/1460</id>
  <link href="http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/issues/1460"/>
  <title>Link to WCAG 2.1 instead of 2.0?</title>
  <updated>2023-03-23T08:42:59Z</updated>
  <media:thumbnail width="40" height="40" url="https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/99a4297c867eada2606b9b6973f081f9?s=80&d=identicon"/>
  <author>
    <name>Byte Blaze</name>
    <email></email>
  </author>
  <summary>Link to WCAG 2.1 instead of 2.0?</summary>
  <description>### Discussed in https://github.com/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/discussions/1459

&lt;div type=&#39;discussions-op-text&#39;&gt;

&lt;sup&gt;Originally posted by **robinmetral** August 10, 2022&lt;/sup&gt;
Can we link to the WCAG 2.1 website instead of WCAG ...</description>
  <content>### Discussed in https://github.com/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/discussions/1459

<div type='discussions-op-text'>

<sup>Originally posted by **robinmetral** August 10, 2022</sup>
Can we link to the WCAG 2.1 website instead of WCAG 2.0? I'm not sure if this is consistent throughout the site, but I'm seeing it on e.g. the checklist links to success criteria. For instance, users are sent to [3.1.5 Reading Level (WCAG 2.0)](https://www.w3.org/TR/UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20/meaning-supplements.html) instead of [3.1.5 Reading Level (WCAG 2.1)](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/reading-level.html).

Am I missing a reason why these should continue to link to 2.0?</div></content>
  <labels>
    <label>claimed</label>
    <label>content</label>
  </labels>

      <email></email>

    <email></email>
  </assignee>
</entry>
<entry>
  <id>http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze/a11y-webring.club/-/issues/21</id>
  <link href="http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze/a11y-webring.club/-/issues/21"/>
  <title>[Feature suggestion] Color theme slider</title>
  <updated>2023-03-27T20:17:14Z</updated>
  <media:thumbnail width="40" height="40" url="https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/99a4297c867eada2606b9b6973f081f9?s=80&d=identicon"/>
  <author>
    <name>Byte Blaze</name>
    <email></email>
  </author>
  <summary>[Feature suggestion] Color theme slider</summary>
  <description>### Feature suggestion

The color of the site is determined by three custom properties, `theme-h`, `theme-s`, and `theme-l`, which are used to create a `hsl()` color declaration.

Modifying the `theme-h` custom property in the `:root` ...</description>
  <content>### Feature suggestion

The color of the site is determined by three custom properties, `theme-h`, `theme-s`, and `theme-l`, which are used to create a `hsl()` color declaration.

Modifying the `theme-h` custom property in the `:root` selector allows the entire site to adjusts its theme color. I think it would be fun to have a little input range slider that allows a visitor to tweak the color from 1 to 360Â°, and then store the value to local storage.

### Who would you like to work on this feature?

- [ ] I would like to work on this feature
- [ ] I would like the site maintainers to work on this feature

### Code of conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's code of conduct</content>
  <labels>
    <label>feature</label>
    <label>help wanted</label>
  </labels>

      <email></email>
    </assignee>

</entry>

  <summary>[Feature suggestion] Add a submission form</summary>
  <description>### Feature suggestion

Netlify provides a contact form, and we just happen to use them. Setting one up will drastically lower the level of technical knowledge to participate, so it would be a good addition to the site.

Ideally a subm...</description>
  <content>### Feature suggestion

Netlify provides a contact form, and we just happen to use them. Setting one up will drastically lower the level of technical knowledge to participate, so it would be a good addition to the site.

Ideally a submission could be set to trigger a PR review for manual vetting.

### Who would you like to work on this feature?

- [ ] I would like to work on this feature
- [ ] I would like the site maintainers to work on this feature

### Code of conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's code of conduct</content>

  <content>### Feature suggestion

Until @patrickhlauke's [WCAG trash panda webring](https://mastodon.social/@patrick_h_lauke/109733347231039895) gets off the ground, this webring will have to suffice.

We should have a toggle to enable trash panda mode for the webring landing page, whatever that may be.

step_data.thought: I have successfully reached the issues RSS feed page and now I need to copy the URL from the address bar to be able to subscribe to the feed. This is the final step in the process.
